Anti-U.S. civic organization formed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Anti-U.S. civic organization formed in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- 23 organizations of South Korea including the citizens federation for economic justice, the council for national reconciliation and independent reunification and the South Korean youth federation reportedly held a meeting of all representatives and chief executive members on June 19 and formed the "civic association against the projected building of the U.S. embassy and its apartment houses in the site of the Deogsu palace."
 The organizations have waged a campaign to frustrate the building since they held a press conference in late may. Since June 29 they have held a demonstration everyday in front of the site and staged a cyber signature campaign through internet homepage.   At least 10,000 citizens have joined the campaign.    
 Their demonstrations and signature campaign are aimed to designate Jongdong area as a "cultural area" and nullify the plan to build the U.S. embassy and its apartment houses.

Greetings to President of Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela
     Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today sent a message of greetings to president Hugo Chavez Frias on the occasion of the independence day, the national day of the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela .
 The message sincerely hoped that the president and people of the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela would achieve greater success in the work for the progress and prosperity of the country by successfully carrying out the Bolivarian revolution, expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, in the future, too.

articles.title: Greetings to Comoran President
articles.content:
Greetings to Comoran President
    Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on July 3 sent a message of greetings to president of Comoros Azali Assumani on the occasion of the 27th anniversary of its National Day.
 In the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would develop on good terms in the interests of the two peoples in the future, too, the message wished the president new success in the work for the unity of the nation and the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Malawi
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Malawi
    Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on July 1 sent a message of greetings to Malawi President Bakili Muluzi on the occasion of the 38th anniversary of its independence and the 36th anniversary of the proclamation of the Republic.
 In the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would develop on good terms, the message wished the president and people of Malawi greater success in the independent development and the prosperity of the country.
